content.heading: William Henry Perkin
content.passage: As a boy, Perkin’s curiosity prompted early interests in the arts, sciences, photography, and engineering. But it was a chance stumbling upon a run-down, yet functional, laboratory in his late grandfather’s home that solidified the young man’s enthusiasm for chemistry.

text: Michael Faraday was the first person to recognise Perkin’s ability as a student of chemistry.
Michael Faraday suggested Perkin should enrol in the Royal College of Chemistry.
Before Perkin’s discovery, with what group in society was the colour purple associated?
What potential did Perkin immediately understand that his new dye had?
